intro: Psychotria camponutans, commonly known as the "cocoanut psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. Psychotria camponutans is often found growing in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth.
